deity_markdown: [Azathoth](/Deities.aspx?ID=567), [Dwarven Pantheon](/Deities.aspx?ID=196), [Grask Uldeth](/Deities.aspx?ID=555), [Kerkamoth](/Deities.aspx?ID=140), [Kostchtchie](/Deities.aspx?ID=77), [Lady Nanbyo](/Deities.aspx?ID=311), [Magrim](/Deities.aspx?ID=450), [Minderhal](/Deities.aspx?ID=494), [Shapes of the Fading Luster](/Deities.aspx?ID=373), [Stone's Blood](/Deities.aspx?ID=382), [The Laborer's Bastion](/Deities.aspx?ID=253), [Torag](/Deities.aspx?ID=294), [Trudd](/Deities.aspx?ID=451)
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Warhammer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=403)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Shove" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=193" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 278 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Favored Weapon** [Azathoth](/Deities.aspx?ID=567), [Dwarven Pantheon](/Deities.aspx?ID=196), [Grask Uldeth](/Deities.aspx?ID=555), [Kerkamoth](/Deities.aspx?ID=140), [Kostchtchie](/Deities.aspx?ID=77), [Lady Nanbyo](/Deities.aspx?ID=311), [Magrim](/Deities.aspx?ID=450), [Minderhal](/Deities.aspx?ID=494), [Shapes of the Fading Luster](/Deities.aspx?ID=373), [Stone's Blood](/Deities.aspx?ID=382), [The Laborer's Bastion](/Deities.aspx?ID=253), [Torag](/Deities.aspx?ID=294), [Trudd](/Deities.aspx?ID=451)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 1 gp

**Damage** 1d8 B

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Martial

**Group** [Hammer](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=8)
</row>

</column>

---

This weapon has a wooden shaft ending in a large, heavy metal head. The head of the hammer might be single-sided or double-sided, but it's always capable of delivering powerful bludgeoning blows.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-8" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Weapons</title>
[Sky Hammer](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2872)
name: Warhammer
